arm_group.arm_group_label: Marketed cow milk-based premature infant formula
Marketed extensively hydrolyzed casein infant formula

brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate the use of a hypoallergenic infant formula containing an extensively hydrolyzed
      protein source for routine nutrition.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tolerance of an Extensively Hydrolyzed Protein Infant Formula Versus a Premature Infant Formula

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Premature infant 28 to 33 weeks gestational age, inclusive, at birth

          -  Infant has never received enteral feedings or current enteral intake is less than 30
             mL/kg/day

          -  Birth weight is greater than or equal to 700g to 1750g

          -  Appropriate birth weight for gestational age

          -  Singleton or twin birth

          -  Signed Informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Infant's mother plans to exclusively breast feed

          -  5 minute APGAR score is less than or equal to 4

          -  Major surgery that required general anesthesia prior to randomization

          -  Ventilator-dependent or requiring greater than 40% FiO2 on day of randomization

          -  Grade III or IV intraventricular hemorrhage diagnosed prior to randomization

          -  Infant is currently participating in another clinical study

intervention.arm_group_label: Marketed cow milk-based premature infant formula
intervention.intervention_name: Marketed cow milk-based premature infant formula

required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Gastric residuals, regurgitation(>1 ml), fecal output (number of stools per day)
Apnea and/or bradycardia events, use of supplemental oxygen, use of mechanical ventilation
Fecal calprotectin, alpha and beta defensins, TNF alpha, gastric ultrasound

secondary_outcome.measure: Confirmed or suspected sepsis or necrotizing enterocolitis

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Double-Blind, Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
